questions.text: What is the formula for calculating power when energy and time are known?
Which property is used to measure the conductivity of a material?
Which type of conversion is used to regulate the voltage levels of a three-phase supply?
In a circuit with multiple current sources, how is the superposition theorem applied?

choices.text: Each current source is turned on individually and the resulting voltage is added together
Each current source is turned on individually and the resulting voltage is subtracted from the total voltage
Each current source is turned on individually and the resulting current is added together
Each current source is turned on individually and the resulting current is subtracted from the total current

questions.text: What is the equivalent resistance seen from the output terminals in Norton's theorem?

choices.text: The total resistance of the circuit
The resistance of the load resistor
The resistance of the voltage source
The resistance seen from the output terminals with all voltage sources replaced by their internal resistances

questions.text: What is the maximum value of an alternating voltage or current called?
What is the typical forward bias voltage of a silicon diode?
What is the function of the amplifying device in an oscillator circuit?
What is the operating mode of a Class C output stage?
What is the process of gradual conduction transfer called in a Class AB output stage?
What is the base of the hexadecimal number system?
What is the voltage range for a logical 1 in CMOS logic?
What is the Boolean expression for the NOR gate?
How many data inputs does a 2:1 MUX have?
What is the truth table for a demultiplexer?

choices.text: Same as a multiplexer truth table
Opposite of a multiplexer truth table
Same as an AND gate truth table
Opposite of an AND gate truth table

questions.text: Which of the following flip-flops is an edge-triggered flip-flop?
What is the function of the Arithmetic and Logic Unit (ALU) in a microprocessor?

choices.text: It controls the flow of data within the microprocessor
It performs arithmetic and logical operations

questions.text: Which type of memory is used for temporary storage of data and instructions that the CPU is currently processing?
Which of the following is an example of a hardware interrupt?

choices.text: A timer reaching its count limit
A user pressing a key on the keyboard

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true about the interrupt priority levels in a microprocessor?

choices.text: Lower priority levels have higher priority
Higher priority levels have higher priority
The priority levels are not important in interrupt processing
The priority levels are determined by the external devices

questions.text: How can we pass a pointer to a function as an argument?
How do you assign values to members of a structure in C?
Which function is used to write data to a file?
What is the purpose of using the using keyword with namespaces in C++?

choices.text: To create an alias for a namespace
To bring all the members of a namespace into the current scope
To hide certain members of a namespace
To define a new namespace within an existing namespace

questions.text: Can a non-constant member function be called on a constant object in C++?

choices.text: Yes, but only if the function does not modify any data members of the class
No, a non-constant member function cannot be called on a constant object
Yes, but only if the function is declared const

questions.text: How is the unary minus operator (-) overloaded in C++?
What is a pure virtual function in C++?

choices.text: A virtual function with no body in the base class
A virtual function with a body in the base class
A virtual function with no body in the derived class

questions.text: Which header file needs to be included to use manipulators in C++?
What is the purpose of specialization in function templates?

choices.text: To define a specific implementation of a function template for a particular data type
To create a new function template
To define a specific implementation of a function template for a variable number of arguments

questions.text: What is the syntax for specifying a default template argument for a class template in C++?
The term 'memory hierarchy' refers to:

choices.text: The order in which data is accessed by the CPU
The organization of different types of memory by speed and capacity
The way in which the CPU processes instructions
The way in which data is stored on a hard drive

questions.text: Which of the following is responsible for translating virtual addresses into physical addresses?
What is the result of performing a bitwise XOR operation on the binary values 1011 and 1100?
Which type of memory is non-volatile and retains its contents even when power is turned off?
Which of the following is NOT an example of a storage peripheral device?
What is the role of a microcontroller in an embedded system?
Which of the following is NOT a commonly used memory management technique in RTOS?
Which of the following is a characteristic of a real-time process?

choices.text: It has a fixed start and end time.
It does not require any system resources to execute.
It can be interrupted and resumed at any time.
It has a specific deadline that must be met.

questions.text: What is the purpose of the entity declaration in VHDL?

choices.text: To declare a new signal type
To define the interface of a design entity
To define the implementation of a design entity

questions.text: How is unsigned data represented in VHDL?
Which of the following is a protocol used for managing network devices?
Which of the following is NOT a type of transmission media used in computer networks?
Which of the following is a function of the MAC sublayer of the Data Link layer?
Which error detection method can only detect odd numbers of errors?
Which of the following is an error control mechanism used in data link layer flow control?
What is the subnet mask for a Class B network?
Which Transport layer protocol provides reliable delivery of data?
Which of the following is not a valid HTTP status code?
Which P2P protocol provides a distributed hash table (DHT) to enable file sharing without the need for a central server?
Which type of computer security is concerned with securing software applications and preventing attacks such as viruses, malware, and hacking attempts?
Which of the following is true for a nondeterministic finite automaton (NFA)?

choices.text: A NFA has a unique next state for a given input symbol and current state
A NFA can have multiple accepting states
A NFA can recognize context-sensitive languages

questions.text: Which of the following is a limitation of NDFA?

choices.text: It can only recognize regular languages.
It is more difficult to construct than a DFA
It requires more memory than a DFA
It is slower than a DFA in recognizing languages

questions.text: What is the minimum number of states required to represent a language that accepts all strings over the alphabet {0, 1} that have an even number of 0s and an even number of 1s?
What is the meaning of the plus (+) operator in regular expressions?

choices.text: Matches zero or one occurrence of the preceding symbol or expression
Matches one or more occurrences of the preceding symbol or expression
Matches exactly one occurrence of the preceding symbol or expression
Matches the complement of the preceding symbol or expression

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding the performance of regular expressions and finite automata for a given language?

choices.text: Regular expressions are always faster than finite automata for the same language
Finite automata are always faster than regular expressions for the same language
Regular expressions and finite automata have the same performance for the same language
The performance of regular expressions and finite automata is unrelated to the language they represent

questions.text: Which of the following is not a method for converting a context-free grammar to Chomsky normal form?
What is the halting problem?

choices.text: The problem of determining if a Turing machine will eventually halt.
The problem of determining if a Turing machine is deterministic or non-deterministic.
The problem of determining if a language is regular or context-free.
The problem of determining if a Turing machine is in the correct syntax.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a popular 2D graphics software?
Which of the following transformations rotates an object around a fixed point?
Which of the following is an example of a composite transformation that can be used to simulate camera movement?
What is the maximum number of children a node in a binary tree can have?
Which of the following describes the upper bound on the time complexity of an algorithm?
Which of the following is a disadvantage of using a linked list to implement a list?

choices.text: Constant time access to any element

questions.text: Which sorting algorithm is based on the concept of a priority queue?
Which layer of the ANSI/SPARC architecture defines the overall schema for the database?
In a database, what is a foreign key?

choices.text: An attribute in one table that refers to the primary key of another table
An attribute that is used to link two strong entity sets
An attribute that is used to link two weak entity
An attribute that is used to link a weak entity set to a strong entity set

questions.text: Which ACID property ensures that transactions do not interfere with each other?
What was the main objective of the development of real-time operating systems?

choices.text: To improve the performance of general-purpose operating systems
To provide support for scientific and engineering applications
To support time-critical applications such as industrial automation and medical systems

questions.text: Which of the following is used by the CPU to translate a virtual memory address to a physical memory address?
What is the role of the page replacement algorithm in memory management?

choices.text: To allocate memory to processes as they are created
To select a page in main memory to be replaced with a page from disk when there is no free memory

questions.text: Which software characteristic refers to the ability of software to meet its intended purpose and perform its required functions?
Which software process model is best suited for projects where requirements are not well understood and may change frequently?
What is the purpose of creating wireframes in the design process?

choices.text: To create a visual representation of the design

questions.text: What is the principle of hierarchy in design?

choices.text: It refers to the arrangement of elements in a design from most important to least important
It refers to the use of contrasting colors in a design
It refers to the use of repetition in a design

questions.text: What is the main advantage of using automated unit testing?

choices.text: It is faster and less error-prone than manual testing
It can test the entire system at once
It can identify all possible defects in the code
It requires less technical expertise than manual testing

questions.text: Which of the following is a metric for measuring the efficiency of test case design?
Which modeling technique is used to create use case diagrams?
Which of the following is not a step in the design phase of OOAD?
What is agile development methodology in software development?

choices.text: A software development process that emphasizes incremental and iterative development, frequent customer feedback, and collaboration between team members
A software development process that emphasizes documentation, planning, and strict adherence to a predefined schedule
A software development process that emphasizes testing and quality assurance, with the goal of achieving zero defects
A software development process that emphasizes creativity and innovation, with the goal of producing groundbreaking products

questions.text: What is the purpose of class documentation?

choices.text: To provide a brief description of the class and its purpose
To describe the attributes and methods of the class
To make the code easier to understand and maintain
